Introduction

Get familiar with the basic setup and overview of the META+LAB UI Kit.

Note: First of all you need to download UIkit. For other packages and links to a CDN, head to the installation guide to learn more.

Download

#Package

The Zip file contains the compiled CSS and JavaScript files, which is everything you need to get started.

#HTML Markup

Add the compiled and minified CSS and JavaScript to the header of your HTML5 document. For your basic setup, that's it.

  
    <DOCTYPE html>
    <html lang="en">
      <head>
        <meta charset="UTF-8">
        <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1">
        <title>Title</title>
        <link rel="stylesheet" href="..dist/css/meta-ui.css" type="text/css">
        <link rel="stylesheet" href="https://cdn.metalab.csun.edu/fonts/din/MyFontsWebfontsKit.css">
      </head>
      <body>
      <--!Add Your Code Here & Start Building-->
      </body>
    </html>

#What's Included

When you download META-UI Kit via Bower, the following source files will be available to you.

  
    
    META-UI Kit
      ├── CONTRIBUTING.md
      ├── LICENSE
      ├── README.md
      ├── bower.json
      ├── dist/
      │   ├── css/
      │   │   └── meta-ui.css
      │   ├── fonts/
      │   └── js/
      │       └── meta-ui.js
      ├── docs/
      ├── .editorconfig
      ├── gitignore
      ├── mix-manifest.json
      ├── package.json
      └── src/
          ├── js/
          └── sass/
